intro: Magydaris hirta, commonly known as the hairy magydaris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom during the warmer months. Magydaris hirta is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
